name: kimbo_chop
text: oh man, phillipe is just too hilarious for words.

name: lk
text: A comment left by lk was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by enough_talk, shrewbie, AtlanticCity)

name: hipjiverobot
text: All flailin' around I bet.

name: hawaiian_robot
text: Just like Teodor said.

name: mattydread
text: Diabetes ain't ballin'.

name: biznart
text: It is not rad to have.

name: centipede_damascus
text: Subway doesn't want people to know that you can get diabetes from their food.

name: howard
text: Philippe is 6!

name: foolio
text:
If you were born in 1997 and it's currently 2003, you may be 5 or 6.

Of course, now Philippe was born in 2002.

name: straw
text: Stop screwin with my mind!

name: epicurus
text: Philippe has what is known as a "migrating birthday".

name: never_die
text: Philippe's answer to diabetes is a candy bar.

name: valrus
text: "How about by not givin' a shit!"

name: tinhand
text: Philippe has been 5 for 5 years now. I like the way his legs seem to be going somewhere on his gravestone.

name: deusoma
text: except that the gravestone says his legs are 6.

name: luckypyjamas
text:
I believe that Philippe's year of birth changes with the year so he is perpetually five

which means now in 2007 his year of birth was 2002

granted, in this circumstance he would have to start aging next year, as it doesn't really make sense for him to only be five but appear in six years worth of comics

name: semiquaver
text:
Shutupshutupshutupshutup shutup!!!!

Philippe is five!

name: luckypyjamas
text: Not Anymore!

name: semiquaver
text:
DIE.

Wanders off to cry in the corner.

name: ford
text: Chubbied because i laughed out loud at the image of Stephen Colbert narrating your two above posts, then running off to cry.

name: semiquaver
text: You will never love America.

name: tekende
text: Really? Does it make sense for the characters in The Simpsons to have stayed the same age for over twenty years?

name: greenkoolayd
text: best comeback!

name: m3funkyb
text: phillipe looks evil when he's fat

name: songbirdspectre
text: read my mind.

name: i_love_kate
text: No thanks.

name: katsura
text: The pants died along with him.

name: drskradley
text:
The depiction of pants are in remembrance of a better time, where he was free to where pants.

His shoes also died. And also, whilst he was walking.

name: straw
text: Mid-stride is no time for an otter to die.

name: apocowarg
text: awww they had to amputate his legs a year before he died. poor insulin management, phillipe!

name: apocowarg
text: Nice job stating the obvious, self. This comment adds nothing to the conversation and simply states what is shown in the strip. I disappoint myself. What is with the not capitalizing? I will check back in another year and reassess your/my attitude.

name: spinynorman
text: I do not remember Waylon Jennings

name: irondave
text: He was supposed to be on Buddy Holly's airplane.

name: fuckin_wizard
text: Waylon was in his own words "a rambling man." I don't think he ever wrote a song about how he ate so much Subway that it gave him diabetes. But he should have.

name: scorpio_nadir
text: Oh hell, he dint! He wrote exactly that song! Then he died, age 6. Look it up!

name: ortsac
text: Reading this strip again, I never knew that Todd had a Subway franchise.

name: ham_shoes
text: I bet the bathrooms are nassty

name: ravindra108
text:
I would never eat anything that came from Todd's Subway... He's most likely peed in several of the condiments, and he probably passes out before closing time, so stuff never makes it back into the fridge.


Also, he is fictional.

name: blarghamagarky
text: 'Course he's fat! Bein' fat rocks!

name: korukyu
text:
obese otter = adorable.
Now, in the words of Ultra Peanut, Philippe really is a "Real super-size homo jackass!"

name: charchar
text: Phillipe puts his pancreas on the line for his friends. A brave fool and a very special boy.

name: d-pad
text: Man, as someone who grew up a diabetic, this only reminds me of how fun it was to have your parents constantly telling you you were going to lose your feet. This is not a fun thing to be told when you are 5.

name: irondave
text: Couple questions, and I am in earnest here:  Did they tell you that to scare you off eating things that might be a problem?  And, how are you doing now?

name: heccibiggs
text: Dead.

name: heccibiggs
text: Shit I immediately feel awful about this comment, I really hope you aren't dead d-pad.

name: jun
text: The dirt on the top half's grave is still fresh, but grass has grown over the legs' grave. Brilliant.

name: paco
text: Theodore isn't one to talk about being fat.

name: zem
text: especially the way he's drawn here jesus it looks like he ate a bowling ball

name: radarjammer
text: Teodor is still chubbier.

name: babeeazz
text: is it just me, or does philippe look like a very small, very chubby penis on his gravestone?

name: libelandslander
text: He didn't, but thats the kind of thing you can't unsee after someone else points it out.

name: mikeronomicon
text: I love the few times that Philipe gets his knickers in a knot. His face is priceless. I'm trying to imagine a pissed off five year old and it just makes me laugh my ass off.

name: clockworkorange
text: I just noticed an odd detail in this strip: Todd, of all people, had a subway. I feel like we missed out by never having his highlighted in the strip.

name: heccibiggs
text: Can we just take a moment to appreciate that, one, Philippe's legs have actually been buried in a grave and two, each gravestone bears a picture of the person within it. Hilarious.

name: tandembandit
text: I like that his eyebrows appear and disappear with his emotions.

name: nixnada
text:
Nice attention to detail there - in the year between the burial of his legs and that of the rest of him, the grass has grown back over the first grave. It's the little things that mean so much.

To me.
